title: System Engineer
description:
Our client is seeking a Network Engineer with strong Linux and networking knowledge, along with scripting language experience, to join their team in Munich, Germany. The role is hybrid, requiring both on-site and remote work. The ideal candidate will have proficiency in German (B2) and English (C1), with extensive knowledge of Linux systems, networks, and automation tools.

Technologies


 * Python, Bash, Perl
 * Linux (Debian, CentOS)
 * Git
 * MySQL
   
   

Requirements


 * 3+ years of programming experience in at least one scripting language (Bash, Perl, or Python preferred).
 * Strong Linux and networking knowledge, with command line proficiency.
 * Experience with Icinga, Puppet, Hiera, Linux KVM, Git, Facter, Ansible, or MySQL is a plus.
 * Knowledge of monitoring tools, switches, routers, firewalls, and load balancers.
 * German (B2 level) and English (C1 level) proficiency required.
 * Ability to work hybridly in Munich, Germany.
   
   

Responsibilities


 * Plan, design, and maintain the company's intercontinental network across six global locations.
 * Optimize the data center packet switching infrastructure for reliability, low latency, and throughput.
 * Ensure network security using OpenBSD firewalls and connect to customers via leased lines and VPN.
 * Extend and develop automated network configuration tools using 100% open-source software (e.g., Ansible, Python).
 * Participate in a rotating on-call system (about one week every five, fully compensated).
 * Assist with maintaining around 600 Linux servers (Debian 12, CentOS 8).
 * Opportunity to broaden skills by learning new technologies such as Kubernetes and Puppet.
   
   

Skills: linux kvm,kubernetes,firewalls,git,facter,python,vpn,scripting,networking,ansible,perl,bash,openbsd,switches,puppet,icinga,linux,hiera,monitoring tools,routers,mysql,load balancers

title: Web Developer
description:
The Eclipse Foundation is one of the world‚Äôs largest open source software foundations, with a proven track record of enabling developer-focused open source innovation earned over 19 years. The Foundation is the home of numerous industry-leading projects and collaborations including Adoptium, Software Defined Vehicle, Eclipse IDE, IoT and Jakarta EE. Supported by over 385 members globally, the Foundation has an established international reach and reputation.

The Eclipse Foundation is seeking a talented Web Developer to join our team. In this role, you will help grow our services, support the open-source community, and build innovative solutions in a transparent and collaborative environment.

Our dynamic team of developers works openly to serve a diverse set of stakeholders, leveraging a broad range of technologies to deliver seamless, non-disruptive solutions. If you're excited to tackle challenging requirements, tight deadlines, and shifting priorities to create meaningful impact, this may be the opportunity for you!

About The Eclipse Foundation

The Eclipse Foundation is a global, not-for-profit, member-supported organisation that hosts the world-class Eclipse Java IDE and over 420 open-source projects. We help foster an open-source ecosystem while promoting complementary products and services.

As part of our IT team, you‚Äôll play a key role in meeting the Foundation's technical needs and supporting its large community of open source developers.

Responsibilities


 * Develop and maintain frontend web applications and web components
 * Build and maintain APIs and supporting backend code
 * Work with technologies such as Quarkus, PHP, Docker, React, Drupal, and MariaDB
 * Write and maintain unit tests to ensure code quality and reliability
 * Optimise applications for speed and scalability
 * Contribute to the open-source projects we utilise
 * Write clear, comprehensive documentation for all code
   
   

Required Skills & Work Experience


 * 2-5 years of web development experience
 * Ability to read, understand, write, and test Java, PHP, and JavaScript code
 * Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and familiarity with preprocessors like SASS or LESS
 * Experience working with RESTful services and APIs
 * Experience with version control systems, including GitHub and/or GitLab
   
   

Assets


 * Experience with relational databases (e.g., MariaDB)
 * Knowledge of Node.js and TypeScript
 * Experience with the Bootstrap CSS framework
 * Familiarity with Drupal and static site generators like Hugo
 * Knowledge of Kubernetes and/or OpenShift
   
   

Work Skills


 * Ability to work autonomously in a geographically distributed team
 * Follow and understand coding best practices and participate in our code review process
 * Strong attention to detail and excellent communication and collaboration skills
   
   

Education

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).

Location

This is a remote position, and the selected candidate will be expected to work from their home office. All qualified candidates will be considered, with preference for candidates based in Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and Belgium.

To Apply

To apply, please submit a detailed resume and cover letter. We offer highly competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted. For more information about the Eclipse Foundation, please visit our website at eclipse.org.

The Eclipse Foundation respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities and is committed to providing accommodation and support to persons with disabilities throughout any recruitment process, once made aware of a need for accommodation. If you require any special accommodation or support during the recruitment process, please indicate in your email to us.

description:

We're on a mission to create joy for pets and their parents, driven by our core values of Care, Courage, Openness, and Simplicity. At the heart of everything we do, they inspire us to grow, raise the bar for our customers and fuel a pet-first business.

Job Description

This role is responsible for building, operating, and maintaining the services and applications assigned to the team during their lifecycle. It consists of the "Plan-Build-Run" model for applicable applications. You will be part of a team of 8 engineers in three locations across Europe and in close collaboration with a variety of different internal and external stakeholders. As part of your job role you need to fulfill a couple of different tasks:


 * Maintain a solution proactively (Security and Minor Changes)

Qualifications

    * SharePoint Online/ OneDrive
    * EntraID Enterprise Applications (SSO, SCIM, API)
    * Office 365 Apps
    * Microsoft Teams
    * Power Platform (PowerAutomate, PowerApps)
    * PowerBI/ Fabric
    * EntraID/ Active Directory
    * Microsoft 365 Backup (Commvault Metallic)
    * Security & Compliance (EntraID Security/ Microsoft Purview)

 * PowerShell Scripting
 * Familiar with the DevOps toolbox git, Jira, Confluence, BitBucket and others
 * Good verbal and written communication skills
 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
 * Good organizational and time-management skills

 * Fluent business English
   
   

Additional Information

With more than 1,000 passionate professionals located across 10 European offices, we believe our success comes from working together and leveraging our international strengths. Expect to work in a hybrid environment, collaborating with colleagues in different locations remotely.

title: System Engineer
description:
The Role

The Systems Engineer is part of the engineering team that develops marine navigation and bridge systems for OSI‚Äôs government and naval markets. The Systems Engineer plays a critical role in the development of the overall system requirements‚Äô design and definition for OSI‚Äôs complex products. With offices globally, OSI Maritime Systems are now opening in Kiel, Germany. This role will be a part of the growth of this office.




Key Responsibilities

 * Assists senior engineers in developing design concepts and generates technical proposal material in response to Request for Quotation (RFQ)
 * Develops system designs, performs functional analysis, defines systems architecture, defines interfaces and specification, performs trade-studies and documents the design by writing SSDD, ICDs, SRS
 * Performs requirement analysis, traceability and maintenance of requirements
 * Coordinates design of subsystems and integration of total system
 * Identifies, analyzes and resolves program support deficiencies
 * Develops and recommends corrective actions
 * Designs to government standards, including Military and IMO standards, ensuring ongoing compliance and adherence to requirements
 * Ensures availability, reliability and other logistics support considerations are part of the system design process
 * Reviews obsolescence issues and recommends design changes
 * Attends and participates in customer design reviews and acceptance events
 * May participate in system integration tests, trials, and acceptance tests at customer facilities
 * Writes acceptance test procedures
 * Manages scope of work, schedules work, estimates effort and costs, and identifies technical risks; effectively communicates status on a regular basis to management




Qualifications

 * Degree in Engineering or Physics, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience
 * 4 years‚Äô engineering experience, Minimum 3 years‚Äô experience in Systems Engineering;
 * Experience in marine electronics and integrated bridge systems a significant asset; experience in defense or government domain preferably in naval ship sector a significant asset
 * Strong knowledge of marine navigation and tactical sensors or systems;
 * Excellent knowledge of Systems Engineering principles, standards and best practices;
 * Familiarity with requirements and verification management tools such as DOORS;

title: System Engineer / Network Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
System Engineer | Network Engineer (m/f/d)

Karlsruhe INIT GmbH

Your First Insight

If you are a computer specialist with a passion, then you can set the digital course with us as a System Engineer | Network Engineer (m/f/d) so that our hardware and software solutions work in our customers' IT infrastructures all over the world. Our 10-strong team in the heart of Karlsruhe creates the technical basis for our customer projects and we need reinforcements for this.

What You Can Expect

Your core tasks are the provision and support of IT infrastructures in our national and international customer projects for sustainable local public transport. You act as an integrator between the various specialist departments within INIT and form the fundamental interface between hardware and software.

Here Is An Insight Into Your Tasks


 * In coordination with our technical project teams and our customers, you will take care of the provision of the required resources (on-premise, virtual and in the cloud)
 * Among other things, you set up network and security infrastructures, virtualization platforms, Active Directory and configure operating systems and services in this context
 * Monitoring and carrying out 2nd / 3rd level error analyses and troubleshooting in cooperation with our development department are part of your job
 * As part of your role, you will work on the creation of our technical concepts and documentation for our worldwide tenders
 * You continuously eliminate vulnerabilities and support the further development of our customers' infrastructures and their services as the basis for a sustainable and secure INIT system
 * It is important to you to contribute your technical knowledge and expand it together with us - then you've come to the right place!
   
   

What You Bring With You


 * You have completed an apprenticeship, further training, a similar technical degree (with a focus on IT) or can demonstrate relevant professional experience
 * Good skills in dealing with hardware as well as network and storage technologies
 * Good knowledge in the administration of operating systems (Microsoft and Linux) as well as basics in virtualized environments (VMware, Hyper-V) and their data security (e.g. Veeam and Symantec)
 * Experience with cloud technologies would be ideal!
 * You enjoy occasional customer visits to experience the results of your work live on site
 * You communicate confidently in German and English and show initiative - if you speak other languages such as French, great, but this is not a must
   
   

If you don't have in-depth experience in every area, we still look forward to receiving your application!

See for yourself and become a part of INIT - we look forward to hearing from you!

Your Benefits With Us Include


 * Flexible working hours and mobile office option
 * 30 days of vacation and the option of 5 additional days of "flexi vacation"
 * Gaming zone, massage chair and creative area
 * Additional financial benefits for travel costs and childcare, among other things
 * Up-to-date smartphone (Android/iOS) for professional & private use
   
   

What happens after your application?

After your application, we will review your documents as quickly as possible. The next step is for us to get to know each other in a telephone or digital interview. We will then invite you on site so that you can get to know the potential workplace and some of the team members.

Induction & teamwork are important to us! During your induction, an exclusive "mentor" will be on hand with help and advice. In addition, you can always rely on your team. In this way, you will gradually get to know INIT, our technologies and our work.

Shaping the Future of Mobility - together! Together, we are making an important contribution to the future of mobility and shaping the public transport of tomorrow. Sounds interesting? Find out more on our homepage - www.initse.com.

Any questions?

If you have any questions, we are happy to help and can be reached at jobs@initse.com or +49 721 6100-0!

Marco Emanuele

HR Recruiter

www.initse.com

title: System Engineer
description:
Vay has developed an alternative approach to autonomous driving called Teledriving (remote driving) - to solve transportation in metropolitan areas.

Since becoming the first company that has driven a car on European public roads with no one inside Vay have become the leading Teledriving company in the world setting the global standard for remotely driven vehicles. Vay are now operating a safe, affordable, and sustainable door-to-door mobility service in the Las Vegas, US and will soon begin scaling to other locations in the USA, Europe & beyond. Our Vay Drive service is a driverless delivered, by the minute car rental service, creating an exciting, safe & affordable experience for all.

This is very ambitious. And we can't do it alone. So we'd love to meet you!

The role:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Systems Engineer II or Senior to join our team. In this role, you will take on the critical responsibility of defining system requirements, safety goals, and ensuring vehicle characterisation to support the development and implementation of advanced automotive systems. This position will play a vital role in designing and testing systems related to Safety ECUs, Motion Controllers, Safety, Connectivity, Cloud & App Interfaces and Performance Monitoring. You will also oversee system documentation, reporting, and regulatory compliance in line with industry standards.

The responsibilities:

Requirements Definition and System Architecture:


 * Develop and manage detailed system requirements and architecture for automotive systems, including safety-critical components and performance criteria.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements for Safety ECUs, Motion Controllers and system-level safety goals.
 * Define interfaces for connectivity and cloud-based applications, ensuring integration with vehicle and remote monitoring systems.
   
   

Safety Goals and Compliance:


 * Establish safety goals and standards for system components, working to ensure compliance with industry safety regulations and certifications (e.g., ISO 26262, ASPICE).
 * Collaborate with the safety and compliance teams to integrate regulatory and safety requirements into system designs.
   
   

Vehicle Characterisation and Test Definition:


 * Develop and execute vehicle characterization plans, outlining test parameters and procedures to validate system performance and safety.
 * Define and oversee both in-lab and on-vehicle testing procedures, ensuring alignment with system requirements and safety objectives.
 * Develop testing criteria for motion control systems and safety reactions to evaluate system robustness under various operating conditions.
   
   

Connectivity, Cloud and Application Interfaces:


 * Define interfaces and requirements for cloud connectivity, remote monitoring, and app-based system interactions, ensuring robust communication and data flow.
 * Work closely with Cloud and software development teams to ensure secure and reliable interfaces between vehicle systems and external applications.
   
   

Performance Monitoring and Reporting:


 * Implement performance monitoring frameworks, leveraging data analytics and monitoring tools to track system performance and ensure alignment with safety and operational benchmarks.
 * Document and report on performance metrics, safety compliance, and system testing outcomes for internal and external stakeholders.
   
   

Documentation and Reporting:


 * Develop comprehensive documentation for all system requirements, safety goals, test definitions, and performance monitoring activities.
 * Report regularly to management on project progress, safety compliance, test results, and risk assessments, providing insight into system performance and safety.
   
   

The profile:

Technical Skills:


 * Strong knowledge of automotive safety standards (e.g., ISO 26262, ASPICE) and compliance requirements.
 * Proficiency in requirements management and system architecture tools (e.g., Jama, FlowEngineering, Doors).
 * Knowledge of cloud connectivity, data interfaces, and application integration.
 * Experience with programming languages
 * Familiarity with system monitoring tools (e.g., Grafana) and logging frameworks
 * Understanding of safety protocols, fail-safe mechanisms, and integration testing for real-time systems.
 * Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software or Systems Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
   
   

Soft Skills:


 * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
 * Strong organisational and project management abilities.
 * Effective communication skills, with the ability to document and report on complex systems and safety protocols.
 * Collaborative mindset and a proactive approach to cross-functional teamwork.
 * Ability to transition from methodical design to hands-on at vehicle
   
   

Our values:


 * We pioneer change: At Vay, we're doing work that has never been done before. This comes with challenges, frustrations and failures along the way. We embrace these challenges through perseverance and innovation, delivering creative solutions to overcome them.
 * We fuel collaboration: At Vay, we work as a team and strive for a common goal. We celebrate diversity and encourage different opinions. Our teams and partners communicate and collaborate openly. Together we build, improve, and grow.
 * We drive action: At Vay, everyone takes pride and commitment in their role for every task and every challenge. We are biassed towards action and get behind the steering wheel, even when there is none. We are empowered to take initiative and drive it to completion.
 * We build trust: At Vay, we consistently do the right thing, and follow through on our commitments to stakeholders, users and society. We understand their expectations and always respond in a way that feels human and respectful. We always put safety first and safety second.
 * We create magic: At Vay, we don't just make things that work, we build products people love. We create unexpected and delightful moments for our riders. We design end-to-end experiences that leave a lasting expression.
   
   

Additional benefits:


 * You'll be joining a highly committed, experienced, fun, and international team from over 30 countries. The team has previously worked at companies such as Tesla, Google, Waymo, Zoox, Byton, Argo, Amazon, Uber as well as Audi, BMW, and Daimler and has founded various companies before
 * You would be a part of solving transportation in metropolitan areas all over the world ‚Äì from Europe
 * We organise thoughtful & fun team events throughout the year
 * We provide healthy snacks, drinks, and coffee at our waterfront office in Berlin
 * Company ESOP (stock options)
 * Free German classes
 * Unlimited paid vacation days
   
   

Vay is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

Come join the future!

title: IT System Engineer
description:
Our satellite ground systems are valued by our customers for their reliability and performance. The "Project IT" team designs these systems and is responsible for the regular maintenance, care and regeneration of the components and continuous further development. We are looking for you to operate and constantly improve our systems. As an IT systems engineer, you are instrumental in our success!

Your tasks

title: System Engineer Motor (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated System Engineer to join our team, with a specialized focus on motor development for aerospace applications. As a System Engineer, you will play a key role in the overall understanding, verification, and validation of motor systems for aircraft. Your expertise in aerospace standards, supplier management, and knowledge of electronics and embedded software development will contribute to the successful development of advanced motor systems.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams to gain a comprehensive understanding of motor systems, including electrical, mechanical, and software components, within the aerospace context.
 * Define and establish system-level requirements, ensuring compliance with aerospace standards and customer specifications.
 * Lead the verification and validation activities for motor systems, including developing test plans, conducting testing, and analyzing test data to ensure system performance and safety.
 * Coordinate with external suppliers to manage the development and integration of motor components, ensuring alignment with program milestones and quality standards.
 * Conduct detailed technical reviews of supplier documents, such as requirement specifications, design descriptions, and test procedures.
 * Collaborate with internal stakeholders to identify and resolve system-level issues and challenges, applying sound engineering principles and practices.
 * Contribute to the development and improvement of system engineering processes, methodologies, and tools, with a focus on motor systems for aerospace applications.
 * Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in aerospace standards, regulations, and industry best practices, applying them to enhance motor system development.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
 * At least 5 year of experience in system engineering within the aerospace industry, specifically in motor development.
 * In-depth knowledge of aerospace standards and regulations (e.g., ARP4754A), with a focus on motor systems.
 * Experience in verification and validation activities for safety-critical systems, preferably within the aerospace domain.
 * Familiarity with supplier management, including managing external suppliers and ensuring their adherence to program requirements.
 * Knowledge of electronics and embedded software development for motor systems, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex systems and propose innovative solutions.
 * Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate and present technical information to diverse stakeholders.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * Experience in motor design and analysis, including electrical and mechanical aspects.
 * Familiarity with model-based systems engineering methodologies and tools.
 * Knowledge of aerospace hardware development processes and quality standards, including DO-178 and DO-254.
 * Understanding of safety assessment methodologies such as FMEA and FTA.
 * Proficiency in using requirements management tools (e.g., DOORS) and configuration management tools.
 * Experience with system-level integration and testing of motor systems for aircraft.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing‚ÄØhigh-tech‚ÄØcompany with a superb network of investors and partners‚ÄØ
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch!‚ÄØ
 * Personal‚ÄØaccountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive‚ÄØcompensation‚ÄØpackage
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System Engineer - Connectivity & IoT (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

The purpose of this role is to ensure that the design of the system aligns with overall business objectives, regulatory requirements, and industry standards. The strategic contribution of this role is to ensure that the designed system maximizes value to the company and can be operated efficiently and effectively during its product lifecycle.


 * You will create architecture concepts for integration of various systems
 * You will manage functional and physical integration of systems on aircraft and ground segments
 * You will define and manage hardware and software interfaces
 * You will perform and review requirements decomposition
 * You will support functional decompositions to define aircraft and system functions
 * You will coordinate between multiple stakeholders, internal and external to Volocopter, for the success of our projects
 * You will adapt systems engineering in a pragmatic way to support team objectives and fast development
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Master in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or similar
 * 3+ years of experience in hardware engineering and firmware development, with a focus on avionics systems
 * Strong understanding of UAS and support system functions and systems design
 * Strong understanding of avionics systems, including system-level design, integration, and testing
 * Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
 * Experience in writing and managing requirements
 * Knowledge of regulatory and certification requirements for aviation products, such as RTCA/DO-178, RTCA/DO-254, and ARINC-429 as well as ARINC-825 beneficial
 * Knowledge of the following tools is highly beneficial: Windchill RV&S, Systems Modeling Language (SysML), Unified Modeling Language (UML), Capella, Basic CAD skills
 * Drone piloting experience is beneficial along with pilot license and radio license
 * The following soft skills are highly beneficial:
    * Excellent teamwork communication and collaboration skills,
    * Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment,
    * Ability to manage varied tasks and prioritize workload,
    * Ability to work methodically in a fast-paced environment with evolving priorities.
      

Additional Information

Our Volocopter flight includes:


 * Fast-growing‚ÄØhigh-tech‚ÄØcompany with a superb network of investors and partners‚ÄØ
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch!‚ÄØ
 * Personal‚ÄØaccountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive‚ÄØcompensation‚ÄØpackage
   
   

Diversity at Volocopter:

Our differences are what make us great. Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential.

title: Software tester (m/f/d)
description:
As a software tester (m/f/d), you ensure the quality and stability of our CRM broker software. Your job is as varied as our SaaS. From the creation of the requirements specification to the final implementation of features, projects and customizations, you will accompany the entire development process.

QA / Software Testing / ISTQB / Bug Tracking / Manual Testing / Automated Testing / Test Automation / Regression Testing / Creation of functional specifications

Your advantages


 * Job quality - We organize ourselves according to the Kanban principle. Structured processes and a focus on precision ensure the quality of our software.
 * Good salary - We offer you an attractive, competitive salary that reflects your experience and performance.
 * Work-life balance - Flexitime, 29 vacation days plus company vacations on Christmas and New Year's Eve, home office arrangement and our shared desk help you to organize your working hours flexibly.
 * Onboarding - you start in Support to get to know the software. This is followed by individual training with your personal mentor.
 * Prospects - We support your professional qualification with individual further training measures and modern tools, such as ISTQB certification.
 * Collaboration - You will work closely with developers, product managers and the QA team to agree priorities and find solutions together.
 * Team culture - Look forward to lots of experiences: Team events, our team trip or time together after work.
   
   

Your tasks


 * Test adaptations to our software - from small improvements to complex functions or new modules.
 * Check identified bugs, ensure quality in every release and document them in detail in the bug tracking system
 * Test new features and functions, e.g. the synchronization of property listings with various portals
 * Work closely with software developers and product managers and accompany the implementation from the creation of the specifications to acceptance and presentation in the online help.
 * Plan your own projects and contribute your ideas to further perfect and automate our test processes.
   
   

Your profile


 * Experience as a software tester or developer or as a career changer with an interest in sophisticated software concepts.
 * Knowledge in quality assurance of SaaS software and ideally also in testing Android and iOS apps.
 * Basic knowledge of HTML or a programming language is helpful.
 * You enjoy working in a team and know how to communicate test results clearly and precisely.
 * Very good knowledge of German (at least C1) and good knowledge of English.
   
   

onOffice - Always on your side

More than 6,000 brokers and 35,000 users in Europe use onOffice enterprise every day to manage business processes and marketing. Our aim is maximum stability and security. The Quality Assurance Team contributes to the sustainable success of our customers.

This is your team: Software Development & Operation ( https://onoffice.com/ueber-uns/team-software-development-operation /)

title: IT SYSTEM ENGINEER (M/W/D)
Software Engineer
description:
Mission

Cuinti is introducing a new and 10x more effective way for companies to train their sales teams. Our mission is to be the first to automate the entire sales training process by creating technology that delivers deep knowledge, realistic practice, and tailored feedback that feels genuinely human. In doing so, we aim to make hands-on sales training accessible at scale for businesses, while elevating the growth journey for employees to a level previously only possible with a personal coach.




As our first Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our product and company. You'll work closely with our co-founders to build a platform that is already empowering thousands of employees from leading companies like Audi, Allianz, and AXA.




Cuinti is backed by some of the best angel investors in Europe.




What You‚Äôll Do

 * Work on hard, unsolved Problems: We are battling with what is currently possible. Our conversational AI system has very hard to reach requirements, both technically (such as latency) as well as conceptually (such as making it feel "more human").
 * Amaze our Users: Improve feedback loops and engage with amazing customers (such as Audi, AXA and Allianz) to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements, acting as a bridge between the technical team and business stakeholders.
 * Fine-Tune LLMs and Deploy to Production: Work on fine-tuning large language models to meet specific business needs and establish benchmarking processes to evaluate their performance, including A/B tests and LLM-driven benchmarking.
 * Ensure Security and Data Privacy: Implement robust security measures and authentication protocols to protect user data and maintain system integrity.
 * Innovate and Influence: Bring fresh ideas to the table, influencing product direction and company strategy in a highly collaborative environment.




Tech Stack

Python, Github, Docker, Twilio, Redis, MongoDB, Huggingface, Azure, and more. With freedom to heavily influence our choice of tooling.




Who You Are

 * Pragmatic Developer: Understand coding best practices and know when to apply and especially also when NOT to apply them optimal results.
 * Technical Proficiency: Several years experience in building scalable production systems using Python, Docker, Redis, and MongoDB. Familiarity with Hugging Face models, phone systems and audio data is a plus.
 * Algorithmic Creativity: You have the experience and creativity to build and test new algorithms and architectures.
 * Startup Experience: Proven track record of working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment or similar (e.g. VC or freelance)
 * Based in Europe: Eligible to work remotely in Europe, no matter if you are in Germany, France, Spain or in any other European country.
 * Experienced with production workflows: Proficient in pull requests, code reviews, CI/CD services, deployments, and collaborative development.
 * Data Savvy: Experienced in building scalable data pipelines with a focus on performance and latency.
 * Business Minded: Ability to understand and translate business requirements into technical solutions.
 * Excellent Communicator: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Nice to have

 * Frontend Skills: Experience with React or other modern frontend frameworks to help us improve our frontend
 * Business Background: Prior experience in business roles that enhances understanding of customer needs.
 * Machine Learning Interest: While not required, an interest or basic knowledge in ML can be beneficial.
 * Audio Data & Phone System Experience: Having worked with Œº-law data, knowing audio compression
 * Language Skills: Our product works across many languages, so being a polyglot would help in testing




Why join us?

 * High Impact Role: Significant ownership and the opportunity to shape the product and company direction.
 * Flexible Remote Work: Fully remote startup with the freedom to work from anywhere in Europe and flexible working hours with a monthly remote work budget for co-working or equipment.
 * Personal Growth Budget: Annual allowance for conferences, courses, books, or subscriptions to foster your professional development.
 * Exciting Team Offsites: Regular strategy meetings in fantastic locations across Europe.
 * Performance-Based Bonus: Monthly bonuses in addition to your salary, rewarding your contributions and achievements.
 * Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP): Opportunity to own a part of the company after having proven your impact

Who we are

We are Tim, Allegro & J√©r√¥me. All of us have founded a company before and are passionate about building an amazing company with you as the first hire and corner piece of our team.




Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Even if the current team looks like it lacks diversity, we are very committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcomed and valued. We are convinced that this drives innovation and is the only way forward. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, abilities, and experiences to apply - and we mean it.

title: System Engineer (Data center) [gn]
description:
Your role

At LUMASERV you will manage and oversee our infrastructure running our customers products, serving millions of users every day.

This role involves the operational management of host systems, our routing, switching and storage infrastructure as well as the hardware within our datacenter using latest technologies.

A deep understanding of cloud technologies, network management and datacenter center operations along with a proactive approach to system maintenance and enhancement is required.

You will have the ability to hire and work with your own team supported by our leadership team. Therefore this role requires a combination of technical expertise and leadership skills.

Your todos


 * Ensuring a stable service of network and cloud hypervisors
 * System maintenance, optimisation and extension
 * Patch management
 * Implementation and extension of monitoring tools
 * Building up a team of fellow system engineers
   
   

Your Skills

title: Avionics System Engineer - Integration (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

You are a Senior System engineer experienced in the development of complex systems and you are passionate about making a difference in eVTOL aviation. You have substantial experience in system architecture and requirements engineering and a profound knowledge of the verification and validation aspects in aviation, and in particular avionics systems. Within a multi-disciplinary team, you will coordinate between the various teams and systems to ensure a successful certification of the avionics systems of the Volocopter aircraft.

Tasks:


 * You will handleinternal system engineering process aligned with development lifecycle needs, including requirements management and program milestone deliverables
 * You will facilitatethe integration activities of the newly developed and COTS equipment (e.g. planning the integration tests, review of the test procedures, environmental qualification gap analysis, and others) on equipment level and aircraft level
 * You will as the liaison between the lab test team and the flight test team to coordinate verification activities
 * You will supportthe validation and overseeing the verification activities of the whole Avionics system
 * You will supportthe system level / component level milestones (e.g., PDR / CDR / TRR)
 * You will supportthe development assurance activities (e.g. system audits with authorities for ARP-4754A compliance demonstration)
 * You will generate compliance evidence for the certification (certification plan, test plans, design reviews, analysis reports etc.)
 * You will provide support for formal audits and exchanges with EASA
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering or equivalent
 * Minimum 5 years of proven experience in aerospace development
 * Good knowledge and practical expertise on the system development lifecycle according to ARP4754A
 * Experience in the Avionics functions and technology for the communication, navigation, surveillance, indication, crew alerting, and data recording
 * Knowledge of the certification deliverables for the Type Certificate programs in CS-25/23/29/27 programs
 * Knowledge of the aviation standards such as ARP4761 and DO-160
 * Thorough analytical skills and a structured approach for ‚Äúgetting things done‚Äù
 * Excellent written and spoken English
   
   

Preferred:


 * Experience with software and airborne electronic hardware standards DO-178 and DO-254
 * Experience in working in EASA approved Design Organization (Part21J) is preferable
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing‚ÄØhigh-tech‚ÄØcompany with a superb network of investors and partners‚ÄØ
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch!‚ÄØ
 * Personal‚ÄØaccountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive‚ÄØcompensation‚ÄØpackage
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System and Embedded Developer (m/w/d)
description:
The Barkhausen Institut performs research on the latest hardware, software and communication technologies and demonstrates their application in tomorrow's society. Our goal is to build a flexible and trustworthy IoT platform based on reliable electronics and secure communication methods.

The Connected Robotics Lab merges the results of our research and strives to build compelling demos and visualizations. We aim at showcasing 5G and IoT technologies in realistic real-world applications. With a very flat hierarchy as well as an agile team we provide the perfect environment for you to bring in your ideas. We value communication and teamwork to accomplish our ambitious goals together.

At the earliest possible date, we are looking for a

System and Embedded Developer (m/w/d)

to bring these ideas to life together with us. Besides an engineer with good coding skills we seek someone who participates in the whole development process and shares their unique ideas. The position will initially be filled for a period of 2 years and will be remunerated in line with TV-L E-13. The position aims at supporting further academic qualification (e.g. PhD).

Your Responsibilities Will Include


 * Design and develop embedded devices firmware (AVR, ESP),
 * Test and integrate microcontroller peripherals,
 * Develop automatic firmware and system testing facilities,
 * Develop configuration and interaction tools for our demonstrations,
 * Design and implement monitoring and control components,
 * Perform, support and interpret electronic measurements.
   
   
   

We expect the following


 * University Degree in appropriate field (Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering or comparable)
 * Advanced Knowledge in C++ and Python
 * Work experience in software architecture, automated testing, continuous integration, and version control (Git)
 * Advantageous: Knowledge in RF, Digital Signal Processing, Electronics and Linux
 * Advantageous: Hands-on experience with lab work (Oscilloscope, Spectrum analyzer, Logic analyzer)
 * Open to present and communicate our results to the broad public
 * Very good communication skills in English or German
   
   
   

You are interested, but you don‚Äôt think you meet all the requirements of the job posting? Then you should know: We don‚Äôt hire resumes, we hire people. We are looking for potential and want to actively foster it. That‚Äôs why we encourage you to apply!

What We Provide


 * An open and creative team
 * Agile working hours and workflows
 * Cross-disciplinary projects
 * Work on future technologies
 * Flat hierarchies for your ideas and flexible teams
   
   
   

If you have passion for new technologies and the desire to develop the connected world of tomorrow with us, we are looking for you.

Life and science are compatible at our institute. We offer a range of recognised family-friendly measures, such as part-time work, mobile working and flexible working hours that take family needs into account. We also offer support for arriving in Dresden (all formalities, apartment etc.).

Application Procedure


 * Your application should include: motivation letter, CV
 * Barkhausen Institut strives for gender and diversity equality. We welcome applications from all backgrounds. Severely disabled persons are given preference in the event of equal suitability.
 * We only accept complete documents as one single PDF document by e-mail to Kontakt-Formular . Please reference ‚ÄúSystem and Embedded Developer‚Äù in the subject line. Applications that contain other file formats (e.g. Word, Excel) will not be considered in the selection process. Informal inquiries can also be submitted to the same address.
   
   
   

The data submitted by you in the course of the application procedure will be processed by the Barkhausen Institut (BI). BI shall use the data for the purposes of the application procedure. No data shall be passed on to third parties.

Skills zu dieser Stellenanzeige: Python, C++, software engineer, electrical engineering, RF, Digital Signal Processing, Linux, Git und Lab work

title: Web Developer
companyName: ISCC - International Sustainability and Carbon Certification
description:
Your tasks

At ISCC, we are a group of highly motivated professionals coming from diverse backgrounds with one goal ‚Äì a more sustainable future! If you are passionate about sustainability and want to find a place where you can make a difference, we are looking forward to welcoming you as Web Developer in a permanent full-time position at our ISCC head office in Cologne.

Your tasks


 * You maintain and enhance the company‚Äôs existing WordPress websites, implement new features, troubleshoot issues, and ensure the websites‚Äô security and optimal performance.
 * You leverage your advanced frontend development skills to create responsive, high-performance web applications. You develop custom features and interfaces that extend beyond the standard capabilities of WordPress.
 * You design and implement visually appealing, user-friendly interfaces ensuring an optimal user experience across all devices.
 * You collaborate closely with the Marketing and Communications team to understand requirements, provide technical guidance, and develop creative solutions aligned with brand guidelines.
 * You serve as the primary contact for external service providers, ensuring smooth communication and project execution.
 * You conduct thorough testing of web solutions to ensure they meet the highest standards of functionality, usability, and design.
 * You assist in updating and managing website content, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
 * You maintain detailed documentation of development processes, design iterations, and website updates.
   
   

Your profile


 * You hold a Bachelor's degree in Web Development, Computer Science, UI/UX Design, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
 * You have at least 3-5 years of experience in frontend development, WordPress development and UI/UX design, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous work.
 * You are fluent in both German and English (C1 level), with excellent verbal and written communication skills in both languages. Additional language skills are a plus.
 * You have strong problem-solving abilities and a high attention to detail.
 * You can manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.
 * You possess excellent interpersonal skills and can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners.
   
   

Why us?

We are an international and diverse team of passionate and experienced experts, joining forces for a sustainable future! We believe that our team is our core asset and we support our people as best we can.

To help you build your future and thrive with us, we offer:

Great Team Environment


 * Various team events throughout the year (Celebrating Diversity, Summer Team Event, Christmas Party)
 * Close collaboration with our sister companies GRAS ‚Äì Global Risk Assessment Services, Meo Carbon Solutions GmbH, 4C Services and ClimatePal, giving you even more development opportunities
   
   

Individual learning and development plan


 * Professional onboarding to help you have an ideal start with us
 * Frequently feedback sessions to ensure a high quality of communication and mutual reflection
 * Many free language classes
 * Access to several technical specific as well as training courses
 * The opportunity to work independently and shape processes
 * We promote from within!
   
   

Work-Life Balance


 * Hybrid set-up
 * 4 weeks remote work at a place of choice (after probation)
 * Flexible working hours and trust based working time
 * 30 vacation days and 3 additional vacation days (Christmas eve, new year‚Äôs eve, carnival monday)
 * Sabbatical options
   
   

Financial benefits


 * A generous pension scheme (bAV) in line with our sustainability values
 * JobTicket/Deutschlandticket
 * Annual bonus scheme based on performance
   
   

Wellness Programs


 * Subsidised Urban Sports Club
 * Active Break scheme with weekly Yoga sessions
 * Health weeks promoting healthy habits in personal and professional life

We are looking forward to your application and hope to welcome you in our team soon!

We are a company with equal opportunities for everyone and encourage applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, gender or any other criteria that is not a professional qualification for an open position.

Apply for this job

About Us

ISCC ‚Äì International Sustainability and Carbon Certification is a globally applicable and leading certification system designed to enhance traceable, sustainable, deforestation-free, and climate-friendly supply chains. ISCC certifications are widely recognised and cover sustainable agricultural biomass, biogenic wastes and residues, non-biological renewable materials and recycled carbon-based materials. The development and implementation of different certification standards is ISCC‚Äôs tool to promote its mission to mitigate climate change and bring more traceability into global markets and supply chains. To date, ISCC holds more than 11,300 valid certificates in 129 countries.

Our close-knit team of dedicated, supportive, and highly motivated professionals at ISCC come from a variety of backgrounds, which contributes to the diverse and dynamic work environment. We all work together with a shared enthusiasm for sustainability and a common objective. We look forward to having you join our team at the ISCC headquarters in Cologne if you think we are a good fit for you.

title: Senior System Integration Engineer / System Integrator (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description

The Job briefly

Our Integration Expert is a key member of our IT Run Team responsible for maintaining the highest level of development and after support for key system integrations and processes. The Integration Expert participates in the management, monitoring, and maintenance of innovative solutions between internal and external information systems that support our IT strategy and business objectives.

A Typical Day


 * Manage the deployment and monitoring of key system integrations to our current ERP platform through Boomi and other applications.
 * Cooperation with internal and external customers to support complex business process integrations between systems.
 * Support the implementation of Boomi platform and manage the integration of current systems with and around it.
 * Triage, diagnose, and resolve integration failures in a high paced production environment.
 * Coordinate with the Build team to manage releases aligned with our IT setups.
 * Provide expertise in business process integrations across a broad range of integration patterns and technologies, including CSV, XML, API, and EDI.
   
   

Qualifications

To Land This Opportunity


 * You have at least six (6) years of experience designing, developing, and supporting enterprise scale integrations between internal and external systems.
 * You have a minimum of three (3-5) years of experience to Boomi.
 * You have excellent written and communication skills (English) with proven experience working with internal and external customers, vendors, and technology partners.
 * You have a working knowledge of business concepts and processes (sales order processing, purchasing, distribution, payables, and receivables).
 * You can operate across multiple projects concurrently.
 * You have strong experience with multiple data integration patterns and data formats including traditional EDI (ANSI X12 and EDIFACT), CXML, ODATA, JSON, flat files, and working knowledge of SQL.
 * You have demonstrated experience developing and managing APIs.
 * You‚Äôre familiar with common integration communication methods including https, sftp, AS2, and other types of communication protocols.
 * You have experience defining and executing integration and user acceptance tests as they apply to the development of system integration solutions.
 * You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or related field (or equivalent experience).
 * You enjoy leading the way on large projects with multiple participants across business and technology teams.
 * You love to work collaboratively with the team and share new concepts and ideas.
   
   

Additional Information

About Your Future Team

At REPA, we keep things casual yet professional so you will find your place. Just bring the ‚Äògetting things done attitude‚Äô to the table.

In addition to a secure job in an internationally successful, fast-growing and family-friendly group of companies, you can also expect:


 * Attractive remuneration package including Christmas and vacation pay
 * 30 days vacation
 * Hybrid working model with flexible working hours and flexitime account in a 40-hour week
 * Company pension scheme
 * Canteen with subsidized lunch
 * Team member appreciation
 * Individual training and development opportunities
 * Casual dress code
 * Regular employee events
 * Employees recruit employees-bonus
 * Corporate benefits
 * Job ticket
 * Free employee parking spaces
 * All the traditional benefits like health insurance, paid time away while you re-energize ‚Äì don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve got you covered
   
   

REPA welcomes diversity and is an equal opportunities employer. All qualified applicants are considered regardless of race, religion, skin color, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or disability.

Do you still have questions? We will be happy to answer them! Please send an e-mail to Nadine: [email protected].

Have we piqued your interest? Then apply today! We look forward to receiving your online application.

title: Web Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
description:
Our web-based software - simply manage vehicles digitally!

About AutoDo

For over 25 years, we have been a leading international provider of software solutions for the digital management and marketing of vehicles. With our dedicated team of 15 experts, we successfully advise and support our customers in the car and commercial vehicle sector with extensive web applications, such as a sales workplace. Innovative concepts and a clear customer focus are at the heart of what we do.

Join us at the earliest possible date as a

Web Frontend Developer (m/f/d)


 * Full-time
 * Burgdorf
 * Professionally experienced
 * Immediately
   
   

Your tech stack

HTMLJavaScriptSCSS/CSSBootstrapPHP

What can you expect?


 * You implement sophisticated mobile-first design specifications (responsive, fluid, fixed or adaptive) for new or existing web applications in the PHP/MariaDB environment with JavaScript, HTML and CSS
 * You evaluate, develop and implement innovative features and your own ideas independently
 * You create functional dummies, prototypes and mockups in collaboration with your design/development team
   
   

What should you bring with you?


 * You have experience in front-end development in PHP, basic knowledge of MariaDB/SQL
 * You have very good knowledge of HTML and CSS (preferably Bootstrap with Sass) and basic knowledge of preprocessors, Task Runner or Bundler
 * Ideally, you have good knowledge of client-side JavaScript (preferably Vanilla, jQuery, Vue.js or React) and basic knowledge of Node.JS
 * You have very good language skills in German and English (language level C1)
 * You can organize yourself to a high degree, are willing to change and flexible - even beyond your area of responsibility
   
   

What do we offer you?


 * You can expect exciting development tasks for well-known national and international companies, a lot of personal responsibility and room for ideas and their implementation
 * You will work in a great and dynamic team with a flat hierarchy
 * You can work flexibly for your work-life balance
 * You receive a company pension plan and an automatic, annual salary adjustment
 * We offer you a travel allowance for your additional costs
 * You can look forward to regular team events and a company gym. Of course, you will also receive a free coffee and tea flat rate and a fresh fruit basket every week
   
   

Any more questions?

Then please contact Birthe Henze directly at: job@autodo.de

You can find out more about AutoDo and what drives us at: https://www.autodo.de/

title: Web Developer (Web Components)
description:
Your mission

You will...


 * Work with other engineers to help architect, build and scale our set of web components and BBj Plugins
 * Design and implement new features, enhancements, and optimizations
 * Participate in technical discussions, research, and develop new innovative ways to improve our product
 * Contribute to knowledge tools, communities, and documentation
 * Employee support and induction
   
   

Your profile

Ideally, you combine a certain number of the following skills:


 * 5+ years of professional software development experience.
 * Native JavaScript (ES6+), Typescript, and CSS speaker.
 * Deep expertise in one or more relevant front-end frameworks such as Angular.
 * Experience building reusable UX components or libraries using web components (we use stencil)
 * Familiarity working with tools like Webpack, Rollup & Gulp.
 * Experience with Node.js
 * Experience with test-driven development
 * Some experience with Java and willingness to learn BBj, our dynamic JVM language (we will help you learn it!)
 * Experience working with Sass & stylus
 * Experience building responsive user interfaces
 * Good UX design skills with experience in design tools like Figma & Adobe xd
 * Experience in optimizing delivered code and assets
 * Understanding of best practices for modern web application development and continuous integration and deployment
 * Independent who completes tasks down to a resolution
 * Fluent communication skills in English
   
   

Why us?

You like working on complex systems for professional users? You like the work with international clients of various sizes and industries across Europe and North America? Then this position is for you!

BASIS Europe is the German subsidiary of BASIS International, headquartered in Albuquerque, NM (USA). We make Java-based tools for professional software development and support our customers with technical support, trainings and projects, and we develop complex apps and business applications for our customers.

Key Benefits


 * Training and qualification program
 * Modern, open company culture with flat hierarchy and lean decisionmaking processes
 * Flexible work hours, home office allowance
 * Attractive, performance-oriented salary package
 * Free beverages
 * Parties and Events
 * Jobticket program for public transport
   
   

BASIS software and software tools have been used to develop business solutions for both international corporations and SMEs for over 30 years. More than 1.7 million users across the globe work with the IT solutions tailored to specific customer requirements by BASIS, or its clients and partners.

Operating its own sites in North America and Europe and working with partners in more than 30 countries, BASIS is well positioned on the international stage. The ‚Äúbig little software company‚Äù is privately owned and operated.

BASIS Europe is based in Saarbr√ºcken, Germany. From the European Development Center, BASIS creates modules and customer-specific solution components based on BBj, Java and other technologies, for easy integration with the heterogeneous software environments found in most companies today.

Users of BASIS solutions include Bridgestone, Euromaster, Kleiberit Klebstoffe, Lankwitzer Lackfabrik, Lohn24.de, Mitsubishi, Popp Fahrzeugbau, Sheraton, Stollwerck, T√∂nnies and Tropack.

title: System Engineer Power Distribution (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and innovative System Engineer Power Distributionto join our team. As a System Engineer Power Distribution, you will be responsible for ensuring that the aircraft's high voltage and low voltage power distribution systems and its components meets functional, performance, certification, and safety requirements. You will play a critical role in authoring and reviewing design data, testing, inspection, and analysis documentation that enables the certification and operation of the Power Distribution System while integrated to its applicable aircraft electrical, mechanical, thermal, and logical interfaces. Your strong communication skills and technical expertise will be essential in driving the Power Distribution System design towards optimal performance and compliance.

Your mission during this flight:


 * Work in close collaboration with other Power Distribution System Engineers to execute tasks pertaining the development of high voltage and low voltage power distribution components such as high voltage power centers, circuit breaker panels, low voltage emergency batteries and overhead HV and LV electrical control panels. The work packages will be distributed between team members of the Power Distribution System Engineers based on team members expertise and project demands; therefore, any team member may work on any development elements of these components and their intra and inter-system interfaces (e.g. high voltage batteries, high voltage battery management system, high voltage electric motors, Avionics display systems, etc).
 * Authors and reviews internal and supplier‚Äôs design data (such as requirements specifications and design description documents), testing, inspection and analysis documentation that demonstrates compliance to the applicable system, subsystem and components requirements pertaining the Aircraft‚Äôs Power Distribution System.
 * Authors and reviews internal and supplier‚Äôs Electrical and Communication Interface Control Documents applicable to the Power Distribution System development.
 * Authors and/or reviews the release of Power Distribution System parts and parts assembly contained in the Aircraft Engineering Bill of Materials.
 * Documents, through the applicable company processes, system-level and components compliances and non-compliances to any requirements including relevant aerospace or equivalent complex system development industry (e.g. land and naval vehicles) standards and regulations, such as SC-VTOL, ARP-4754, DO-254, DO-178 and DO-160.
 * Closely collaborate with the certification engineers to ensure that the Power Distribution System design and development activities meet all necessary certification requirements.
 * Reviews suppliers and partners technical documentation for compliance demonstration and dispositions non-compliances, either accepting or challenging the suppliers based on founded technical background.
 * Supports safety engineers with system understanding for safety assessments including support to review failure modes presented in FMEAs, CMAs and PRAs.
 * Collaborate with the test and verification team to define test plans and ensure successful validation and verification of the electrical design.
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
 * Experience in aerospace‚Äôs or equivalent complex systems development industry (e.g. land and naval vehicles) electrical system components design and system integration within a complex system integration product.
 * In-depth knowledge of aerospace or equivalent complex systems development industry (e.g. land and naval vehicles) standards and regulations, such as SC-VTOL, ARP-4754, DO-254, DO-178 and DO-160, and their implications to the development of the system components and its integration.
 * Proficiency in requirements management tools such as Integrity, Doors, Polarion and the theoretical Systems Engineering elements that follows, such as requirements capture, rationales, validation and verification methods, registering and processing of non-compliances, etc.
 * Proficiency in maintaining and updating functional breakdown assessments, either introduced or corrected by the system design while giving support to safety engineers on their SFHA.
 * Ability to author and review engineering documents, such as design description documents, test plans/procedures/results, analysis and inspection reports for compliance demonstration.
 * Fluent in English.
   
   

Preferred Skills:


 * In-depth understanding of electrical components for aviation such as HV and LV fuses, HV and LV SSPCs, HV and LV Contactors, HV to LV DC-DC converters, Diodes, Circuit Breakers, Connectors, Studs, etc.
 * Solid functional understanding of electrical magnitudes (voltage, current, power, energy) monitoring systems and methodologies for controlling electrical connection devices.
 * Solid understanding of standards related to high voltage and safety regulations associated to HV components in aerospace, naval or land vehicles.
 * Proficiency in using engineering tools and software for simulation, analysis, and design such as MATLAB, Python.
 * Experience with advanced electrical technologies and emerging trends in the aerospace industry for high voltage and low voltage power distribution.
 * Basic knowledge of communication buses and their logical integration within and outside the electrical power distribution systems.
 * Understanding of system safety assessment engineering principles according to ARP-4761 or equivalent standard.
 * Experience with model-based systems engineering.
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing‚ÄØhigh-tech‚ÄØcompany with a superb network of investors and partners‚ÄØ
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch!‚ÄØ
 * Personal‚ÄØaccountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive‚ÄØcompensation‚ÄØpackage
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: Avionics System Engineer - Equipment (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Here at Volocopter, we are the pioneers of electric air taxis (electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft - eVTOLs). We have pledged to bring sustainable urban air mobility to life by getting electric air taxis off the ground in a way that complements existing transportation options in megacities across the globe. In 2011 we carried out the first-ever crewed flight of a fully electric multicopter and have since conducted more than 2,000 public and private test flights across the world (www.volocopter.com).

Job Description

Your mission during this flight:

As an Avionics Systems Engineer you'll be part of the Avionics team working on the VoloCity with a focus onsystem development, integration and verification activities.

Your Tasks:


 * Performing Requirement Management of system/subsystem/equipment level requirements in the Avionics domain
 * Performing the requirements validation and support of the requirements verification activities
 * Addressing the problem reports and managing change requests for the allocated system
 * Preparing and performing the system and component design reviews (PDR, CDR etc.), internally and with suppliers
 * Supporting the development assurance activities (e.g. system audits with authorities for ARP 4754A compliance demonstration)
 * Supporting the generation of the compliance evidence for the certification (test plans, design reviews, analysis reports etc.)
 * Facilitating the integration activities of the newly developed and COTS equipment (e.g. review of the test procedures, environmental qualification gap analysis and others)
 * Working closely with specialists in a multidisciplinary team
 * Participating in communication with the certification authority
   
   

Qualifications

Check in your professional skills:


 * Degree in aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, communications engineering or related field
 * Minimum 5 years of proven experience in aerospace development
 * Detailed knowledge and practical expertise of ARP4754A and DO-160
 * Knowledge of the certification deliverables for the Type Certificate programs in CS-25/23/29/27 programs
 * Proven track of requirements engineering with requirement management tools like Integrity or DOORS
 * Experience in working with suppliers for the "build to specification" development and COTS integration for aircraft systems
 * Thorough analytical skills, troubleshooting experience and a structured approach
 * Excellent written and spoken English
   
   

Preferred skills:


 * Experience with software and airborne electronic hardware standards DO-178 and DO-254
 * Experience in working in EASA approved Design Organization (Part21J) is preferable
   
   

Additional Information

OurVolocopterflight includes:


 * Fast-growing‚ÄØhigh-tech‚ÄØcompany with a superb network of investors and partners‚ÄØ
 * Chance to shape the future of aviation
 * Help us to create groundbreaking new projects - from scratch!‚ÄØ
 * Personal‚ÄØaccountability, as well as growth and learning opportunities, based on your personal strengths
 * An inspiring workplace with modern workspaces, flexible hours, quick decision-making, a flat hierarchy, positive leadership, great team spirit
 * Attractive‚ÄØcompensation‚ÄØpackage
   
   

Diversity atVolocopter:

Our differences are what make us great.Here at Volocopter, we value equal opportunities and trust. As air mobility industry innovators, we believe that changing the world starts on team level.We are committed to fosteringanenvironment where everyone feels valued, respected, and empoweredtoreach their full potential.

title: System Optimization Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

100% Fossil-free: We don't just dream of a sustainable and livable world - we shape it together and with passion! For over 20 years, we have been a driving force in the expansion of renewable energies. We generate, store and deliver green energy around the globe - with wind, solar, biogas and hydrogen. Around 1,000 employees at various locations worldwide share our mission: to generate renewable energy sustainably for a livable earth.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Become a part of the ENERTRAG team at our location in Berlin as System Optimization Engineer (m/f/d) and let's advance the energy transition together.

Job Description


 * You work with the System Planning team to perform techno-economic optimisation of Power-to-X projects, guided by specific project assumptions from the project developers.
 * You develop and maintain software tools that support the optimisation efforts of ENERTRAG's System Planning team, ensuring they are effective and up to date.
 * You ensure code versioning, collaboration, and management using Git, following best practices for branching, merging, and pull requests.
 * You adhere to clean coding principles and participate in code reviews to maintain high software quality and consistency.
 * You identify performance bottlenecks and optimize code to improve efficiency and scalability.
 * You help to develop and extend new optimisation models, implementing them in a suitable programming language (e.g., Python).
 * You prepare and present results in a clear and comprehensible manner, using visualisation techniques to enhance understanding.
 * You write reports for internal reviews and decision-making, and conduct site inspections as needed.
   
   

Qualifications


 * You have completed a degree in engineering, physics, mathematics, or a related field, with a specialization in applied mathematics (optimisation, operations research) or energy being a strong advantage.
 * You have at least 4 years of hands-on experience in software development, with advanced proficiency in Python and Git.
 * You have an understanding of energy economics and expertise in numerical optimisation (linear/non-linear programming).
 * You have relevant professional experience in energy system modelling (capacity expansion and production-cost modelling), or have gained experience in energy system modelling and energy economics during post-graduate studies.
 * You demonstrate a structured approach to work, strong teamwork abilities, and a high level of determination.
 * Experience with open energy modelling tools for electricity generation and transmission expansion planning, such as PyPSA, Balmorel, or Calliope, is a plus.
 * You are fluent in English and German a plus.
   
   

Additional Information

#kids: Your children are the most important thing to you? For us, too. That's why you receive a daycare allowance from us.

#jobrad: Would you like to have some innovative wind around your ears? Then use our job bike - also privately.

#vacation: You need new energy and are already in a mood for departure? We offer 30 days of vacation.

#retirementprovision: We are not only thinking about tomorrow for the sake of the environment, but also for you. That's why we offer you access to the Allianz private pension plan. You will also receive an allowance from ENERTRAG SE in the amount of the social security contributions saved.

#mobilework: You want to stay flexible? Depending on the job, we decide together whether you prefer to come to the office or work from home.

#worklifebalance: You know best at what time of the day the drive is strongest for you. Therefore, you also decide at which working hours you want to use your power around the core working hours.

#training: Do you want new impulses to expand your potential? With us you have the opportunity for individual development with a generous training budget.

#health: Your well-being is close to our hearts. So that you don't lose your vitality, we offer you company health management and accident insurance.

#language: Do you speak English? No? Then simply learn it together with us.

#drinksforfree: Water, coffee and tea - if you like, you can also have a juice or fresh fruit.

#teamevents: To let work be work, we invite you once a year to our big summer party and to other team events in between.

#fossilfree: This should not remain just a dream! Take advantage of the great creative leeway to shape a sustainable and livable world.

Do you have any questions in advance? Then please get in touch with your contact person Karo. You can reach her at: [email protected]


 * What counts for us are your skills and your motivation to advance renewable energies with us - not age, gender, skin color, handicap, origin, sexual orientation or religion.
